user_message:
<misra_rule>
MISRA C 2023 Rule 2.1 is: A project shall not contain unreachable code.

</misra_rule>
<response format>
Provide your answer with these fields.
- is_rule_violated: whether the rule is violated or not (true/false),
- scenario: a specific violation scenario.
</response format>
<target_code>
Here is the code of make_blocking:
```c
static void
make_blocking (MHD_socket fd)
{
#if defined(MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS)
  int flags;

  flags = fcntl (fd, F_GETFL);
  if (-1 == flags)
    abort ();
  if ((flags & ~O_NONBLOCK) != flags)
    if (-1 == fcntl (fd, F_SETFL, flags & ~O_NONBLOCK))
      abort ();
#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  unsigned long flags = 0;

  if (0 != ioctlsocket (fd, (int) FIONBIO, &flags))
    abort ();
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
}
```
</target_code>
<target_code>
Here is the code fragment that you need to analyze:
```c
#if defined(MHD_POSIX_SOCKETS)
  int flags;

  flags = fcntl (fd, F_GETFL);
  if (-1 == flags)
    abort ();
  if ((flags & ~O_NONBLOCK) != flags)
    if (-1 == fcntl (fd, F_SETFL, flags & ~O_NONBLOCK))
      abort ();
#elif defined(MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS)
  unsigned long flags = 0;

  if (0 != ioctlsocket (fd, (int) FIONBIO, &flags))
    abort ();
#endif /* MHD_WINSOCK_SOCKETS */
```
Focus on the above code fragment and judge whether it violates the rule 2.1 or not.
</target_code>
scenario: No violation. Depending on build configuration either the POSIX block or the WINSOCK block is compiled; the other is removed by the preprocessor and therefore not part of the translation unit. Within the compiled branch all statements are reachable along some control flow (the abort() calls execute only on error paths but do not make other code permanently unreachable). If neither macro is defined the function is empty but contains no unreachable code.
